<OLD>
> Rat Trap taps feverishly on the computer to try and get it to desis=
t firing on Perceptor, at the same time he was happy to know that Lord Elde=
r had said something to Tucson Prime.
>
> "UGHH! C'mon computer, if I say s=
omethn's okay, it's okay! It ain't like I'm gonna bug ya with a virus! Perc=
eptor's a pred but he's changn' sides! Stupid piece of outdated hardware! W=
ell, at least Lord Elder said somethn' ta Wheels, I don't wanna ever hear h=
im try'n ta put his spark on the line ever again."

<NEW>
The computer read=
ily responds to Rat Trap's wishes and shuts down its
attack sequence. The s=
hield's drop and the weapons go back to stand-by
condition. However on Rat =
Trap's console the computer continues to
register the fact that there is a =
Predacon signature in the area
although all other alarms shut down.

Lord e=
lder looked around the command center, his stance calm and
relaxed. "Don't =
worry." he said consolingly to Rat Trap, "We have lost
too many already, I =
am not looking to loose Tuscon so quickly."

Cheetor came up and stood next=
 to Rat Trap smacking him on the back in
a friendly gesture, "You think you=
 got the computer under control
now?" he said teasing the smaller Maximal a=
s he smiled, "You look like
you couldn't handle it."

<OLD>
> Quickstride a=
nd Night Shift try to deal with Noctorro, but his prodding was getting on t=
he Autobot's nerves more than anything else.
>
> "Look, we're don' the best=
 we can, and we really don't know what we're dealn' with here, this is comp=
letely alien ta all of us and you're gonna have ta show some patience."
>
>=
 Quickstride snorts and looks over to Noctorro.
>
> "C'mon, give us some br=
eathing room will ya?! Geeze!."

<NEW>

Noctorro looked like he was about t=
o go off for a moment, his optics
looking a definite crimson as he locked g=
azes with Quickstride.
However Airhammer stepped in the middle of them and =
looked back at
Noctorro, "Maybe we can go find out. It's obvious they have =
much work
to do."

Noctorro nodded and laughed as he rubbed the back of his=
 head with a
nervous almost embarrased gesture, "Sure." he said looking def=
initly
sheepish. "You're right, let's go."

"Airhammer looked at Quickstrid=
e and Nightshift, "He get's that way
sometimes, but he means well." he said=
 quietly as they turned to leave
the room.

<OLD>
> Outside, Tucson Prime a=
cknolwedges the readiness to come aboard.
>
> "This is Tucson Prime to Lord=
 Elder, I'm comming back to the Ark as you requested. And let's see what th=
e medics can do, if they need my help I'm here to give to them. Perceptor, =
Talon, don't worry, you will not be losing me any time soon, I assure you. =
I wonder if I can get a link up with Rodimus remotely. As an Autobot we sho=
uld be able to com link with each other."
>
> He attempts to connect with R=
odimus's com link, hoping to get through to him.

Elder responds from the c=
ommand center, "I will pass that on to them.
I am sure they are working as =
hard as they can." Elder said, trying
keep the peace, and yet trying to kee=
p Tuscon from jumping headlong
into sacrificing himself again.

Tuscon atte=
mpts to connect with Rodimus but get's no response. It is
as if his radio i=
s offline or not responding. Perhaps it has something
to do with the fact t=
hat Rodimus is completely wrapped in the strange
alien metal tendrils.

(TA=
G)

Preston
